result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody J Dye was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Impersonating a Peace Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.70(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow for transfer to Dane County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Mental health evaluation and treatment as deemed appropriate by Agent.

Criminal Thinking Class if Agent deems appropriate.
No contact with the victims (M. G. or J. G.) listed in the Criminal Complaint.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Attorney Wolff.
Treatment Letter, received and filed in court.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Cody J Dye in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  
Jury Trial Cancelled.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defedant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
125 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  9 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Dane County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Criminal Thinking Class if agent deems appropriate.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victims (M.G. or J.G.) listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment as deemed appropriate by agent.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
